newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian Sukhoi Log gold output may reach 60 T/year.
newsitem.headline: Russian Sukhoi Log gold output may reach 60 T/year.

text.p: Output at Russia's giant Sukhoi Log gold field could reach 60 tonnes a year in the next millenium, an official at miner Lenzoloto said on Thursday.

"Peak production could be as high as 60 tonnes a year, depending on the technical options we will have," said Alexei Mikhailov, secretary of the board of directors at Lenzoloto, which is to tender a stake in its unit that will tap the field.
He said initial production would commence within three years of receiving financing for the project, and was targeted at 13 tonnes a year.
Lenzoloto will tender a 49 percent stake in its unit Sukhoi Log, a joint-stock company, in March, a Natural Resources Ministry aide said earlier on Thursday.
Sukhoi Log is the largest gold field in the former Soviet Union and possibly one of the biggest in the world, with 1,100 tonnes (about 35 million troy ounces).
Mikhailov said earlier that Star Mining Corporation of Australia was the preferred bidder in the tender.
Russia's 1996 gold output was 124 tonnes, slightly above 1995's 122 tonnes, according to Industry Ministry figures cited by Prime-Tass news agency last week.
